reviewText:
So i looked at the price and figured i'd give it a go, £2.00 well spent!
You have different zombies with different skills, for instance one who just runs and jumps, one who slithers around walls one who flys with ♥♥♥ assistance ( farts ) etc. Get to the exits by unlocking doors using their different skills. Has some old school elements of timing your jumps as well. Some of the puzzles lead you into believing you need the wrong type of zombie so you will find yourself choosing the wrong one and then suddenly it clicks and you kick yourself for the 20 minutes you just wasted pointlessley. You get a rating ( up to 3 stars ) for your time and how many of your zombies you killed in the process, some levels allow you to expire a few zombies as it is neccesary, others will deduct stars from you for killing any of your zombies

Seems to be very well made and  i havent encountered any problems so far. plays very smoothly with the xbox pad. if you love puzzles/ platformers / zombies you cant go wrong - especially at the sale price.
voteText: 32 of 41 people (78%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Despite the name Rotten Edition, this game is not rotten game, it's brilliant platformer game.
Unique concept with many kinds of zombie combined with a platformer game, and leveled game with star rating like Angry Bird.

Quite a challenge to get 3 stars in some levels.
1 star for reach the finish
1 star for get all the brains
1 star for finish the level below a certain time (this is the harder part), as time is still ticking while changing the zombie after a run.

There isn't much of a story, but the game mechanic and concept are good. Makes me want to play the next level over and over again. It usually the story that makes me want to continue the game.
There are 70 test levels within 5 phase with phase 1-4 contain 15 tests and phase 5 contains 10 tests.

There are also trading cards and achievements that makes it more fun to play.
Definitely recommended.
voteText: 12 of 13 people (92%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I am recommending this game because it is very well done, and probably fun if you like this type of game.

I wish they had made it more clear that this is not a standard platformer. I probably just didn't pay enough attention.

Picture a mobile game where you are running right constantly and can only jump. It's kind of like that, but much deeper, and one zombie can jump, another can stick to surfaces and loops around platforms (there may be more than 2 types). You cannot turn around and run the other way, at least with the two zombies I tried. You choose which zombie to use and which way to start running at the beginning of each attempt at the level.

The puzzles are clever, but do take a lot of trial and error.

If you like puzzle games, i'ts defintely worth the money.

reviewText: It's cool , but gets boring pretty fast.

reviewText: An awesome puzzle-platformer game. To beat the 70+ levels, you'll first need to figure out the approach to tackle them, and then reach the exit. There's enough diversity in the levels, and some act as tutorials for some new mechanics that are gradually introduced. For me, the puzzle sections aren't really that hard, but some of the platforming sections are. However, this game has simple controls. For each deadling, you only use one button for control. One deadling walks, two use jumps (but one stick to the walls) and another fly. This last one i find quite annoying to control, t's like flappy bird, but much better. Even at full price, the lenght and variety of this game make it worth. Last, i need to adress two bonus levels: 3 and 10. Those were very hard for me to beat, because you need to control the flying deadling (the worst one) for a long time and you need to be very precise. A very cool indie to your library, especially on sale.
voteText: 6 of 6 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I do not understand the hate that this game is getting: It isn't Super Meat Boy, but it is a pretty decent game, and quite cheap.

For those complaining that there is a lack of a tutorial, I'm rather dissapointed. A tutorial for this game is about as necessary as directions on a shampoo bottle.

At the start of the level you are able to look around the typicall small level, and decide upon a strategy. Usually these aren't too difficult, and it should be rather obvious what you need to do. You then select the zombie you wish to use for that attempt, and choose a direction for the zombie to run (left or right). From there, it is mostly just a timing based game, as you'll need to click at the proper times so your zombie doesn't get chopped to pieces by buzzsaws or whatever.

As I said before, this game isn't amazing, but it definitely shouldn't be considered a bad game. I got it in a bundle, and I intend on finishing it, as it should only take about 3-4 hours for a single playthrough (I'm currently 1/4 of the way through with .6 hours, but I've kind of been rushing through).

Would recommend if you want to get it in a bundle or on sale, or at full price if you've exhausted some of the better options for games of this genre.

reviewText: For a completionist-type gamer, such as myself, completing ALL the levels with ALL the brains in the designated time is indeed quite the challenge. One that makes me use foul language with a frequency significantly above average. But the satisfaction, oh, the satisfaction that comes after...\nBonus points for utilising the now ubiquitous zombie motive and not making it a cliche that makes people yell 'NOT AGAIN' and burst into tears.

this is a fun game, it has nice visuals, its quirk, but thoser have blood.
this isn't  really a platformer, but instead a bit more of an action puzzle game like portal
you control diffrent types of zombies, diffrent levels will give diffrent types of zombies, which are required to beat the level.
the zombies are always moving,except for the last one you get, and they can turn if they a spring or for the flying one, a wall.
the controls aren't bad, although i do find the flying one the worst to control due to very slight delay for starting to propel up.
lv 40 and onwards really makes it annoying
but,its still a fun game to play
i recommend getting this game

reviewText:
Basically feels like a 'dumbed down' mobile game that has no place on the PC platform.

I say no because it is just a trial and error precise timed jumps automated platformer. I thought it was a game where I could platform myself through a level but you don't actually control the characters. You press a button to make a zombie come out of a door and you hit the jump button at the right time to make him jump during his automated walk cycle. All you do is press jump when needed. In the levels I played, you had to press jump immediately as he comes out to avoid a sawblade but it takes a few tries to get the timing down perfectly. I'm sure it is challenging but who cares. I thought it was a platformer and it isn't.

I wasn't expecting much since I bought a bundle for Crimsonland so this is an afterthought and not really what I want in a game. It just makes me want to play Angry Birds or other similar but better games on my Windows phone.

voteText: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
The art style and soundtrack are cool, and the gameplay is pretty good, but it's too impractical to be a paid game. It seems more like something you'd play on kongregate when you got a couple of hours to kill. Figuring out a level takes about 1 minute, and then it's just hoping you don't screw up the platforming (And if you're playing on nigtmare or going for all brains, Morgan Freeman bless you.) The levels go one at a time, so if you're stuck, you can't do anything, unlike games like Super Meat Boy where if you're stuck, you at least have another level to play.

Overall, the concept is cool, the art and soundtrack were pretty good, but the gameplay was executed poorly.

5/10

reviewText: This game is definitely a game. It's like... interactive and... uh oh... I don't know. It's like Super Meat Boy in wheelchair. The levels are more like puzzles where you choose a zombie and set it to motion. The zombie then moves forward and you can press a button to make it jump but not to turn around or slow down. Then there's this another zombie that sticks to ceilings and you collect brains like meat boys bandages and... It's so hard to concentrate on what this game is about when it's such a crappy little piece of copy-paste. Paste brings me to the fact that this game is as exciting as toothpaste. It's usable but not fun. I played first 6 levels (got 3 stars in all of those, so proud!) so I'm expert in these things, you can believe me. I even got the first collectible card so I must be pretty good. Ah, back to zombies. Or not. Play Super Meat Boy instead. It's better even if you don't like it.

The game is incredibly light on anything that might explain it - clearly it suffers from its crummy smartphone roots.\n- Cute graphics and the controls feel solid

reviewText:
All the idiots who compared this to Super Meat Boy should be vivisected with a fondue fork and it is shameful of the devs to quote not one but two reviews who use this comparison which makes no sense whatsoever.

The game has ONE thing going for it, the artstyle is nice and it looks good overall, but past that, it's a tedious platformer without the most basic element of a platformer: Control. The zombies move automatically which leaves you with 2 decisions: which direction to start running and when to jump, which makes for a fairly unpleasant experience.

All in all, not worth my time and energy.

reviewText:
-- Six important points about Deadlings: Rotten Edition --

1) The title music is insanely cool!

2) A lot of reviews compare this to 'Super Meat Boy' and 'Plants VS Zombies'. Those a rubbish comparisons. Deadlings is a side-scrolling puzzle platformer: you evaluate the level, decide which zombies are best at each task, then you set them running into the level (inputting single commands like jumping, but never directional input). This game is immensely more like 'Lemmings' and a little bit like 'Braid' and other less-manic puzzle-platformers.

3) The fact this game isn't like those other famous titles is not an insult. This game is a great little gem! As you progress, the game expands on your options and the depth of the puzzles. I highly recommend not worrying about good scores initially and instead try to clear levels, otherwise you won't see much of the game's brilliant concepts for a long while.

4) This game is very much worth it's asking price, and it's an easy purchase when on sale! Few games are both this well made, and be within anyone's price range. Not perfect, but nothing that would really ruin your fun.

5) You can only unlock one level at a time, by completing the previous level. If you are stuck, this game doesn't offer you much else to do. This is the game's one major flaw.

6) There's also a weird interaction that 'Bonebag' (your fast-running zombie that jumps) will literally explode if he runs into a wall or clips into the side of a platform. It makes sense from a gameplay-design perspective, but is visually doesn't make sense and it's infuriating to behold! Just a minor flaw but when puzzle games can be taxing on your patience, you REALLY notice stuff like that! Especially since everything else in the 'Rotten Edition' is so crisp and well designed!

-- MY RATING: 8.7 --

Get it cheap, play it little-and-often, and enjoy!

reviewText: This is one of the most frustrating games I have ever played.  That is not entirely bad.  I got through the game a few levels a day, since that was about all I could take.  I thought there was 15 levels and I was OK with that, but it turned out to be 60 levels, with 10 bonus levels.  In 15 hours I completed all 60 with 3 stars (one for completion, one for all brains and one for beating the time) and a few of the bonus levels, with a few levels completed on nightmare difficulty.  That's right, a difficulty that is just off the charts.  Needless to say, the difficulty is not for everyone and I got my money's worth without trying the extreme frustration level.  So even skipping like half the game, it is well worth buying and I highly recommend it.
